Created attachment 569306 bad-request.txt User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16 (.NET CLR 3.5.30729) Build ID: 20110319135224 Steps to reproduce: I saw the problem only once for now. Not sure how to reproduce it. I worked with Testopia and probably clicked Testopia links in the header before the previous Testopia page was fully loaded by the browser. Actual results: I got to a situation where any request to the server resulted in the following error: 400 Bad Request

Bad Request

Your browser sent a request that this server could not understand.
Size of a request header field exceeds server limit.

Cookie: <...>

The 'Cookie: ' part in the above citation is cut out to make the report readable. I am attaching the bad-request.txt file with the full server request to the bug report. Expected results: I think the problem should not occur. A workaround is to delete all cookies for the bugzilla site.

comments.author: carenp_@hotmail.com
comments.text:
definitely confirmed.  has been seen when the number (and or the size) of requests is large.  with a small corporate database (thousands of bugs), make dozens of search queries per day without closing down the browser.  what seems to occur is that all requests are stored within the cookie.  eventually, the cookie simply has too much information within, and every/any query, even the simplest request, is refused until you kill the browser cache and the cookie for bugzilla, then close the browser.

have seen this several times over the past few weeks.
